services.description: Expert garage door spring replacement across the DFW area. Fast service to restore your garage door's functionality with North Texas-tested components.
services.content:
Broken garage door springs are one of the most common issues DFW homeowners face, especially with our temperature extremes. Our expert technicians provide fast, professional spring replacement to get your door working safely again across Bedford, Arlington, and surrounding areas.

## DFW Spring Repair Service

- Torsion spring replacement (most common in our area)
- Extension spring replacement
- High-cycle spring upgrades for heavy use
- Dual spring systems for larger doors
- Safety cable installation for security

## Why Springs Break in North Texas

- Normal wear and tear from daily use
- Extreme temperature changes (common in DFW)
- Rust and corrosion from humidity
- Improper maintenance
- End of lifespan (7-10 years typical)

## Our Spring Replacement Process

1. Safe spring tension release
2. Old spring removal
3. Shaft and bearing inspection
4. New spring installation
5. Proper tension adjustment for North Texas conditions
6. Full system testing

seo.metaTitle: Broken Spring Repair | Garage Door Spring Replacement TX
seo.metaDescription: Fast garage door spring repair & replacement. Expert technicians & quality parts. Same-day service available - call Mikes now!
seo.keywords: broken garage door spring, spring replacement, torsion spring repair, Mikes Garage Doors

contentVariations.opening: A broken garage door spring means your door won't open, and that's not just inconvenient, it's potentially dangerous. Springs are under extreme tension and should only be replaced by trained professionals. Our same-day spring replacement service gets you back in operation quickly and safely, with springs rated for years of trouble-free performance.
contentVariations.whyChoose: Spring replacement isn't DIY territory, it requires specialized tools and training. We replace hundreds of springs annually, understanding exactly which spring type, size, and cycle rating your door needs. We also know that when one spring breaks, its mate is likely near failure too, so we recommend replacing both springs together to prevent another breakdown weeks later.
contentVariations.closing: Don't stay trapped in or out of your garage. Call now for same-day spring replacement service. We stock a complete range of spring sizes and can typically complete replacement within 1-2 hours of arrival.

uniqueFaqs.question: Why did my garage door spring break?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Garage door springs have a finite lifespan measured in cycles (one open/close = one cycle). Standard springs are rated for 10,000 cycles (about 7-10 years for typical use). Springs break due to normal wear, metal fatigue, rust and corrosion, extreme temperature changes, or lack of lubrication. If your door is 7+ years old and has never had springs replaced, it's within expected lifespan.

uniqueFaqs.question: Can I open my garage door with a broken spring?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Never attempt to open a garage door with a broken spring manually or with the opener. The door becomes extremely heavy (150-400+ lbs) without spring assistance and can fall suddenly, causing injury or property damage. If your spring breaks with the door closed, leave it closed and call for service. If it's open when the spring breaks, don't close it, we can secure it in place during repair.

uniqueFaqs.question: Should I replace both springs even if only one broke?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Yes, strongly recommended. When one spring breaks, the other has experienced the same cycles and stress and will likely break soon, often within weeks or months. Replacing both springs together saves you the inconvenience and cost of a second service call soon after. It also ensures balanced door operation since both springs are equally tensioned and new.

uniqueFaqs.question: What are high-cycle springs and are they worth it?
uniqueFaqs.answer: High-cycle springs are rated for 25,000-30,000 cycles (compared to standard 10,000-cycle springs), lasting 2-3 times longer. They cost about 30-50% more but provide significantly better value over time. We recommend high-cycle springs for frequently-used doors (multiple family members, home businesses) or doors in hard-to-reach garages. For most homeowners, they're an excellent long-term investment.

uniqueFaqs.question: How long does spring replacement take?
uniqueFaqs.answer: For experienced professionals, typical spring replacement takes 1-2 hours including removal of old springs, installation of new springs, precise tension adjustment, balance testing, and safety checks. Unusual door configurations or additional issues discovered during service may extend this time. We'll provide an accurate estimate when we assess your specific situation.

Track alignment isn't just about quiet operation,it's about ensuring your door opens and closes smoothly while protecting your investment in springs, rollers, and other components. Our technicians use specialized tools to check track angles, spacing, and alignment, then make precise adjustments to ensure smooth, quiet operation. uniqueFaqs.question: What causes garage door tracks to become misaligned?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Tracks can become misaligned due to foundation settling, impact damage, loose mounting bolts, temperature changes affecting building structure, or normal wear over time. Heavy doors or high-use applications may require more frequent track adjustments.

uniqueFaqs.question: How can I tell if my tracks need alignment?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Signs include noisy operation, jerky movement, door binding or sticking, visible gaps between rollers and tracks, or if the door doesn't close completely. You may also notice increased wear on rollers or unusual sounds during operation.

uniqueFaqs.question: How often should tracks be checked and aligned?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Tracks should be inspected during annual maintenance and aligned as needed. High-use doors may need more frequent checks. We recommend professional track alignment if you notice operation issues, after any impact damage, or as part of regular preventive maintenance.

uniqueFaqs.question: Can misaligned tracks damage other door components?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Yes, misaligned tracks can cause premature wear on rollers, strain springs, damage hinges, and affect opener operation. Proper track alignment is essential for protecting your entire door system and preventing costly component failures.

uniqueFaqs.question: How long does track alignment take?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Professional track alignment typically takes 1-2 hours including inspection, measurement, adjustment, and testing. We also check related components like rollers and hinges to ensure optimal door performance.

- Prevents opener strain
- Extends spring life
- Ensures smooth operation
- Reduces noise

### Our Balancing Process
1. Disconnect opener
2. Manually test door movement
3. Measure door position at rest
4. Adjust spring tension

6. Reconnect and test opener

contentVariations.opening: Proper lubrication and spring balancing are essential for smooth, quiet garage door operation and long component life. Without regular lubrication, metal parts wear prematurely and create friction that strains your entire door system. Spring balancing ensures your door operates with minimal effort while protecting your opener and other components.
contentVariations.whyChoose: Lubrication and balancing require specific knowledge of your door's components and the right products for each application. Our technicians use premium lubricants designed for garage door systems and have the expertise to balance springs properly. contentVariations.closing: Keep your garage door operating smoothly and quietly with professional lubrication and balancing service. Regular maintenance prevents premature wear and ensures optimal performance. Schedule your lubrication service today.

uniqueFaqs.question: What parts of my garage door need lubrication?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Key areas include: roller bearings, hinges, spring coils, cable pulleys, and track contact points. We use different lubricants for different components,dry lubricant for tracks, oil for bearings, and grease for springs. Each component has specific lubrication requirements for optimal performance.

uniqueFaqs.question: How often should garage doors be lubricated?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Most garage doors need lubrication every 6-12 months, depending on usage and climate. High-use doors or harsh environments may need more frequent lubrication. We can recommend a schedule based on your specific door and usage patterns.

uniqueFaqs.question: What's the difference between lubrication and balancing?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Lubrication reduces friction and wear on moving parts, while balancing ensures your door's weight is properly distributed between springs and opener. Proper balancing prevents strain on your opener motor and ensures smooth operation. Both are essential for optimal door performance.

uniqueFaqs.question: Can I lubricate my garage door myself?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Basic lubrication of accessible parts is possible, but professional service includes hard-to-reach areas, proper product selection, and spring balancing. Our technicians have the tools and expertise to lubricate all components safely and effectively.

uniqueFaqs.question: What happens if my door isn't properly balanced?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Unbalanced doors strain the opener motor, cause uneven wear on components, and may not operate smoothly. This can lead to premature opener failure, spring problems, and increased energy consumption. Proper balancing is essential for long-term door health.

uniqueFaqs.question: What's the difference between chain, belt, and screw drive openers?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Chain drive openers are most affordable and reliable but produce moderate noise, best for detached garages. Belt drive openers operate nearly silently, ideal for attached garages or bedrooms above garages, but cost more. Screw drive openers have the fewest moving parts (lowest maintenance) with moderate noise levels. For most homes with attached garages, we recommend belt drive for comfort and quiet operation.

uniqueFaqs.question: Can I control my garage door opener with my smartphone?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Yes! Modern openers with built-in WiFi (like LiftMaster MyQ, Chamberlain MyQ, or Genie Aladdin Connect) allow smartphone control, real-time alerts, and usage history. You can open/close your door remotely, receive notifications when opened, schedule automatic closing, and even grant temporary access to delivery drivers or guests. These smart features typically add $50-150 to the opener cost.

uniqueFaqs.question: How much horsepower do I need for my garage door?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Most single-car doors work well with 1/2 HP openers. Standard double-car doors need 1/2 to 3/4 HP. Heavy wooden doors, insulated doors, or oversized garage doors may require 3/4 HP to 1-1/4 HP. However, proper door balance is more important than opener power, a well-balanced door operates smoothly with less power, while an unbalanced door strains even powerful openers.

uniqueFaqs.question: Do garage door openers have battery backup?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Many modern openers offer optional or integrated battery backup that keeps your door operational during power outages. This feature is particularly valuable if you park inside and need reliable access during storms or blackouts. Battery backup typically adds $80-150 to the opener cost and provides 20-50 opening cycles per charge, depending on the model.

uniqueFaqs.question: Will a new opener work with my existing garage door?
uniqueFaqs.answer: In most cases, yes. Modern openers are designed to work with standard residential garage doors installed in the last 20-30 years. However, very old doors, custom or unusual door designs, or doors with unique track configurations may require adapters or modifications. We'll evaluate compatibility during our consultation and recommend any necessary adjustments for proper installation.

uniqueFaqs.question: What are the most common garage door opener problems?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Common issues include: opener won't respond to remotes, door opens but won't close, opener motor runs but door doesn't move, safety sensors misaligned, opener makes noise but doesn't operate, or opener works intermittently. Most problems are repairable without full replacement.

uniqueFaqs.question: How do you diagnose opener problems?
uniqueFaqs.answer: We systematically check: electrical connections, motor operation, safety sensors, remote programming, force settings, and door balance. Our diagnostic process identifies the root cause and determines whether repair or replacement is most cost-effective.

uniqueFaqs.question: Can you repair any brand of garage door opener?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Yes, we service and repair all major opener brands including LiftMaster, Chamberlain, Genie, Craftsman, and others. We carry universal parts and can source specialized components when needed. We also work with older or discontinued models.

uniqueFaqs.question: When should I repair vs replace my opener?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Repair makes sense if your opener is less than 10-15 years old and the problem is isolated (motor, circuit board, sensors). Replacement may be better if multiple components are failing, the opener is very old, or repair costs approach 50% of replacement cost.

uniqueFaqs.question: How long does opener repair take?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Most opener repairs are completed in 1-2 hours, including diagnosis, parts replacement, and testing. Complex repairs or parts ordering may require a return visit. We carry common opener parts to minimize repair time.

uniqueFaqs.question: When should I replace instead of repair my garage door?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Consider replacement if: your door is over 15-20 years old, shows significant rust or wood rot, has major structural damage, requires frequent repairs, lacks modern safety features, or doesn't insulate well. Also consider replacement when upgrading home aesthetics, improving energy efficiency, or adding smart technology. If repair costs approach 50% of replacement cost, replacement usually makes better financial sense.

uniqueFaqs.question: What's the best garage door material for my home?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Steel doors (60-70% of market) offer the best balance of durability, low maintenance, insulation options, and affordability. Wood doors provide classic beauty but require regular maintenance. Aluminum/glass doors suit modern aesthetics with natural light. Fiberglass works well in coastal areas resistant to salt air. We'll recommend based on your home's style, budget, climate exposure, and maintenance preference.

uniqueFaqs.question: How much does garage door replacement typically cost?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Standard steel replacement doors range from $1,000-$2,500 installed for double-car garages, depending on insulation level and style. Custom wood doors run $2,500-$6,000+. Modern aluminum/glass doors cost $2,000-$5,000+. Adding a new opener (if needed) adds $300-$600. We provide detailed quotes including all materials, labor, disposal, and warranty during your free consultation.

uniqueFaqs.question: Can I replace just the panels instead of the whole door?
uniqueFaqs.answer: Sometimes yes, especially for newer doors with localized damage. However, panel replacement often costs 40-60% of new door cost, replacement panels may not match faded existing panels perfectly, and you're still left with an aging door system. For doors over 10 years old or with multiple damaged panels, full replacement typically provides better long-term value.

uniqueFaqs.question: How long do new garage doors typically last?
uniqueFaqs.answer: With proper maintenance, steel doors last 20-30 years, wood doors 15-25 years (with regular maintenance), and aluminum/fiberglass doors 20-30 years. Lifespan depends on climate exposure, usage frequency, maintenance, and quality of installation. Our professionally-installed doors with regular maintenance often exceed these averages, and we back our work with comprehensive warranties.

faq.question: How do I know if my garage door spring is broken?
faq.answer: Signs of a broken spring include: the door won't open, the door opens partially and stops, you hear a loud bang or snap, or the door is very heavy to lift manually. If you suspect a broken spring, don't try to open the door - call for professional service immediately.

faq.question: How long does spring replacement take?
faq.answer: Spring replacement typically takes 1-2 hours depending on the door type and complexity. We carry common springs in our service vehicles, so most replacements can be completed the same day. Emergency service is available for urgent situations.

faq.question: What is the cost of spring replacement?
faq.answer: Spring replacement costs vary based on the door size and spring type. Torsion springs typically cost $150-300 to replace, while extension springs cost $100-200. We provide free estimates and competitive pricing for all spring replacement services.

faq.answer: Cable repair costs vary based on the extent of damage and whether replacement is needed. Simple adjustments start at $60, while cable replacement typically costs $120-200. We provide free estimates and competitive pricing for all cable repair services.

faq.question: What are common garage door opener problems?
faq.answer: Common opener problems include: motor not running, door not responding to remote, safety sensors not working, chain or belt slipping, and circuit board failures. Our technicians can diagnose and repair all types of opener issues.

faq.question: Do you repair all brands of garage door openers?
faq.answer: Yes, we repair all major brands of garage door openers including Chamberlain, LiftMaster, Genie, Craftsman, and others. Our technicians are trained on all brands and carry common replacement parts for most opener models.

faq.question: How long does opener repair take?
faq.answer: Most opener repairs can be completed in 1-2 hours. Simple issues like remote programming or sensor alignment take less time, while motor replacement or circuit board repair may take longer. We carry common parts in our service vehicles.
